messages: e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (21:46): oh, more www-archive
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:49): Seriously, I don't follow the argument that because something is new it won't be (ab)used in exactly the same way as current markup
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (21:50): maybe you need some non-logic
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (21:50): b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea: because the new stuff will break in a drocanian way when you abuse it :)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (21:51): and all implementations will be perfect
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (21:51): that would require some language interpreter in new implementations
b25b6b77a0087ff8385941e5545d32ea (21:51): And authors will suddenly start to understand RDF?
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (21:52): right after they bite through namespaces, sure
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (21:52): finally got IRC working in Opera
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (21:52): heh, sorry if the UI was not intiutive
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (21:52): never did chat before -- so who knows?
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (21:53): it looks okay to me
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (21:53): user error
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (21:53): though the latest in UI was that the user can't do wrong
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (21:54): I like that
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (21:54): then it's not my fault
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (21:56): e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0, I liked what you said about non-logic -- I think there is a study to be had there
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (21:56): nevermind, I don't even want to talk about "role"
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (21:57): It looks like one more thing to add to my reading list
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (21:58): I got the idea from Dan that a lot of semantics in the "semantic web" sense can be done through GRDDL rather painlessly without adding markup to HTML
e3fb62ebfa4f36acf5cbff6a6ed0f2e0 (21:59): has to go
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (22:01): maciej, I wonder if we might be able to categorize the prescriptivist arguments.
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (22:01): in some sort of descriptivist way
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (22:02): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884: sorry, forgot to use the <sarcasm> tag :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:02): Opera_9.20_Setup.dmg refuses to mount on Mac OS 10.4.9
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:03): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: I thought the conclusion was that both start and end tags though required may be omitted? :)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (22:03): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: required and may be omitted at the same time?
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (22:03): ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc: not sure what you mean
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:04): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: like <html>, <head>, and <body>
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (22:04): wondered how many different points of view they actually have
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:04): n^2 (where n is the number of members of the WG)
73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46 (22:04): a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554: ah, ok. so you meant that the element is required but the tags may be omitted :)
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:04): 73eaf221abca1b8244e34b0b9e76ac46: yes :)
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (22:04): I think some are saying -- look how scary the web will be if we don't clamp down on grammar now
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (22:05): some seem to have something else going on
139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884 (22:05): well, I don't want to be in the business of classifying arguments I don't really believe in
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (22:05): if it's only n^2 it can be managed with a fairly simple grammar
a11aabeeceeae6b8cb5d12ea06b56554 (22:06): 139513027e8e90b5582cbc68fc733884: anytime I try and say what I think they're saying I just get told that I'm trying to put words in their mouth‚Ä¶
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (22:07): one might be able to hash out a compromise or a synthesis or something ifall those other points of view can be enumerated
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (22:09): I am softening on design principles -- one really DOESN't want to have this particular debate again and again forever
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (22:10): maybe if we had a token economy of some sort and we handed out finitely many words that any side of any debate could use

ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (22:17): ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc should learn how to use 8-)  and so forth (except I don't know what they mean) -- there are lots of humor tags inserted in some of the above
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:17): Ooh, my message arrived on www-html, only four days late
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:18): *messages

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:31): Aha, now I can run XPath queries on ~2000 HTML documents in ~50 seconds, and get totally statistically insignificant results from a heavily biased sample, which might be handy
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (22:43): html-wg irc looks a lot more active when one just reads the logs -- nearly festive at times
ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:45): It's rather bursty, and seems to be going through a quiet patch now
ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (22:47): I tried dinking around with XPATH a little but was unable to write any code that worked across browsers.. Any recos on a good tutorial?

ab7faae5d7b250ea8606486575f8f79c (22:49): Unfortunately I have no idea how to use it in browsers and not much idea how to use it out of browsers either - I'm just doing stuff in Python and copying-and-pasting examples

ca4923f2d198f6bbff488e483461b3bc (22:55): The XSLT code that Dan wrote to summarize the tasks volunteer questionnaire was pretty nifty looking.
